data.title: Good prices
data.text:
Huge selection of tequilas. We just had a Margarita. We got the double but I couldn't really see there was more alcohol in the shot glass. Oh well.

Chips and salsa came with the meal.

We ordered an appetizer of fresco (ftesh) guacamole. It cost about twice the regular guacamole. We were told the fresh version is made on the spot. So does that mean the other is made in advance and just sits around getting old?

It was overly salty. My wife gave up on it. I happen to like salt and persevered for a few more chips but eventually gave up as well. We didn't send it back but should have at least mentioned it.

My wife got a taco salad. I got the beef burrito. The latter came put bubbling on the plate. I had to wait a while for it to cool.

Overall everything was good with the exception of the guacamole.  Portion sizes were large and our server was nice and attentive.

data.title: Still good!
data.text: I used to frequent Santiagos at the old place before it burned down. After years away, I'm glad to see they've kept most of the old menu. Not that I can really give an honest appraisal; all I ever order is the fish tacos.

data.title: Great food and interesting menu.
data.text: Always fresh, good and unique dishes available.  Great service in a small-town, local atmosphere.  The owners are always there to direct the servers and cook the main items.

data.title: Great food at a great price!
data.text: Santiago's Mexican Restaurant is nestled into a cute spot right on the Yakima Avenue. Their  signature dish,Taco Santiago is delicious as well as their fish tacos! I highly recommend this place and their Happy Hour is great!

data.title: Always Awesome
data.text: Always enjoy this restaurant, and the food is amazing every time.  Great service.  Great atmosphere. Try the beef burrito...yumm!!!

data.title: Great ambiance with excellant service
data.text: Good food and nice ambiance for dinner. Beautiful artwork. Easy to have conversation with friends without being drowned out by loud crowd or kitchen noise, cozy seating and excellant service.

data.title: HORRIBLE!!!!!!
data.text:
You would not believe the level of BAD that this place is.  It has NO redeeming quality at all.  I can't even say that the drinks were good and my water glass was dirty.

Only place I have ever had worse Mexican food was in KY.  Really Really bad!!  Burnt, dry, over seasoned, poor service, over-priced

data.title: Santiagos Restaurant
data.text: Santiagos is almost an institution in Yakima and has been in the same place on Yakima Avenue for many years.  Many of the menu items have been developed by the owner, Jar Arcand, and they are outstanding.  The wait staff are well-trained and can explain any questions about the menu.  There is also a comfortable lounge.  Jar and his wife, Debbie, also do catering - also outstanding.  A great place for good food and company!

data.title: Tasty
data.text: Always great portions and very fresh. Large selection of tequila which in case you were wondering, is a bonus. Margaritas are delicious.

data.title: Wonderful food...good prices
data.text: Nice environment, wonderful food, friendly, helpful staff, and good prices.  I was there last in June, asked the server what a particular dish was like, got an honest, helpful answer, ordered that dish, and I enjoyed it very much!!  I do not do that much in a restaurant, but decided to try asking, and was so happy that I did.  Now I have another dish that I love.

data.title: authentic mexican food
data.text: authentic mexican food,with a twist.. Enjoyed my visit..Nice friendly staff...Restaurant sits in a good location. Close to shopping,and banks.

data.title: Good Tex-Mex in downtown Yakima
data.text: I stopped in here recently on a one-night stay in town. Ambiance is very nice; several TVs in the bar for watching the Mariners (including on the patio); staff are very attentive and helpful. Food is a little bit fancier (and a bit pricier) than the typical Tex-Mex fare, but still plenty cheesy and rich. Margarita was serviceable, but not memorable.  Overall, a solid option.

data.title: It's always good! Great food and ambiance!
data.text:
Gourmet Mexican food! Plenty to share...
I hadn't been there in a while and went last month and it was as I remembered.
Great Margaritas!

data.title: Pretty good food....
data.text: We went to Santiagos based on the reviews here.  It was pretty good-- excellent mole sauce!!! The refried beans were ok, salsa excellent, and a robust tequila selection.  The plates overflowed with food and the value was good for the price.  The service was great and they have nice patio seating.

data.title: Different but really good
data.text: This is one of the better Mexican restaurants in town. The style of food and sauces is different than any of the other Mexican places in town. It is more like the Southern California/Tex mex style I grew up with. The prices are a little higher than other places, but the high quality and quantity of the food more than makes up for it. The decor is great and the service is usually good. The only bad thing I can say is about their seating. I am a heavy guy and there is no way I can squeeze into their little booths. They might pick up a lot more customers if they were to change at least some of the seating to accomodate larger sized guests. When my wife and I go there we have to eat in the bar to be able for me to be seated comfortably and the because the bar is so busy, sometimes the service is not fast and efficient. I am a heavy eater and I always am able to leave with enough boxed leftovers for a meal the next day.

data.title: Amazing Food
data.text: Food was fantastic.   Not your normal greasy mexican food.    Fresh, different and amazing!  Was expecting a little better margarita, but it was still good.

data.title: Yum
data.text: Great menu choices besides standard burritos and enchiladas. Pulled pork tacos, fish and shrimp tostado, ceviche, greek and chopped salads, fish tacos and -hands down- the best happy hour margaritas in town.

data.title: Are you look for Mexican Food and a great bar?
data.text: One of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Yakima is Santiagos.  They have been around for years--because of the great tasting food, super service, fun ambience, and full bar.  Located in downtown Yakima, you'll always find a friendly atmosphere at Santiagos.

data.title: Great service
data.text:
The restaurant was very cool, in the old downtown. Difficult to find, no clear signage. Drove around the block a couple times trying to find it.

Food was gourmet Mexican. My husband and I ordered enchiladas, one with their house white sauce. It was different, too heavy on the sauces, hard to find the tortilla inside. It was good, just prefer Azteca style.

data.title: Not really Mexican cuisine
data.text: The atmosphere was great, but when ordering I asked for a flour tortilla instead of a corn for the enchilada and she said all of ours are pre-made. Silently I said for this price nothing should be pre-made.The chicken looked like the shredded style you can buy from any food service place. The "Jack cheese" was like a gravy without the taste of Jack. The amount was a lot but the taste not so much. I wouldn't go again. But I am new to the area and I am told its an old favorite of many who were born and raised here.
